newsitem.title: USA: NEBRASKA FED CATTLE STEADY $105/DRESSED - PRIVATE.
newsitem.headline: NEBRASKA FED CATTLE STEADY $105/DRESSED - PRIVATE.

text.p: Nebraska feedlot cattle trade near midday Tuesday was light at $105.00 per cwt on a dressed basis, steady with slow sales on Monday, market sources said.
About 3,000 steers and heifers that will likely grade select and choice were reported sold, which brought the week-to-date sales near 10,000, sources said.
There also were a few trades at $105.50 for cattle that will grade mostly choice, they said.
Some other bids at $105.00 were being passed as some owners held out for $106.00. No sales were reported on a live basis, cattle sources said.
